document.discussion_title: FTSE 100 wobbles, as strong dollar pulls commodity shares lower - MarketWatch
document.topic_text: U.K. stocks seesawed Monday, with commodity shares struggling as the U.S. dollar strengthened. The FTSE 100 UKX, +0.19% was up 0.1% at 6,824.45 but has been darting between minor losses and gains. The index on Friday fell 0.2% and ended the week with a 0.8% loss, its first weekly decline in three weeks. Shares of miners and oil companies were down Monday as the dollar gained ground against its rivals. The greenback was bolstered by comments from Federal Reserve Vice Chairman Stanley Fischer on Sunday, in which he said the Fed is close to its targets , suggesting the central bank may be able to raise interest rates soon. The U.S. Dollar Index DXY, +0.28% was up 0.5% at 341.77. As the greenback rose, dollar-denominated prices for oil and most metals were in the red. Copper prices HGU6, -1.11% were off 1%, silver SIU6, -2.18% dropped 2% and Brent crude LCOV6, -1.61% slumped nearly 2% at just under $50 a barrel. London launches all-night metro (1:29) The London Underground will get its first all-night metro, almost three years after the plan for a 24-7 service was announced. London Mayor Sadiq Khan visited the underground ahead of the launch. Shares of copper producer Fresnillo PLC FRES, -3.92% fell 3.8%, Randgold Resources PLC RRS, -3.11% gave up 3.2%, and Antofagasta PLC ANTO, -3.10% moved down 2.1%. Oil majors were lower, with BP PLC BP., -0.21% BP, -0.92% down 0.3% and Royal Dutch Shell PLC RDSB, -0.52% RDS.B, -1.64% off 0.6%. Advancers on the blue-chips benchmark included home builders Taylor Wimpey PLC TW., +1.17% and Berkeley Group Holdings PLC BKG, +1.07% , which rose 1.2% each. Drug maker Hikma Pharmaceuticals PLC HIK, +1.22% picked up 1.2%, and British American Tobacco PLC BATS, +1.11% gained 1.1%. More from MarketWatch Yellen to say ‘ready’ for another rate hike in Jackson Hole My husband mooched off me for 8 years — should I spend my money before we divorce?
